intro: Caroxylon volkensii, commonly known as the Volkensii tree, is a large, deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and large, simple leaves that are alternate along the branches. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and plays a significant role in its native ecosystems.
